member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter`1
member.summary: Defines an interface with which the low-level data contained inside MappingPropertyBag and MappingDataRange objects can be formatted into .NET objects.
member.typeparam: The type of the objects into which the low-level data should be converted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter`1.Format(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange)
member.summary: Formats a single MappingDataRange into the type specified by T.
member.param: The MappingDataRange object to format.
member.returns: The formatted object constructed with the data contained inside the MappingDataRange.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter`1.FormatAll(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag)
member.summary: Formats all MappingDataRanges contained inside the MappingPropertyBag.
member.param: The MappingPropertyBag to format.
member.returns: An array of T objects which represent the data contained inside each MappingDataRange of the provided MappingPropertyBag object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException
member.summary: This exception is thrown by the managed wrappers of ELS when the underlying unmanaged implementation returns an HResult which is not S_OK (0). This exception is also thrown when the managed wrapper detects an exceptional condition which causes it to fail. Please note that other .NET exceptions are also possible to be thrown from the ELS managed wrappers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinguisticException class with the last Win32 error that occurred.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinguisticException class with the specified context and the serialization information.
member.param: The SerializationInfo associated with this exception.
A StreamingContext that represents the context of this exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinguisticException class with the specified detailed description.
member.param: A detailed description of the error.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinguisticException class with the specified detailed description and the specified exception.
member.param: A detailed description of the error.
A reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.ResultState
member.summary: Gets the MappingResultState describing the error condition for this exception.

member.summary: Queries whether the operation completed successfully.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAsyncResult.PropertyBag
member.summary: Gets the resulting MappingPropertyBag (if it exists).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAsyncResult.ResultState
member.summary: Returns the current result state associated with this operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAsyncResult.CallerData
member.summary: Returns the caller data associated with this operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAsyncResult.AsyncState
member.summary: Returns the result state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAsyncResult.AsyncWaitHandle
member.summary: Gets the WaitHandle which will be notified when the opration completes (successfully or not).

member.summary: From MSDN: Most implementers of the IAsyncResult interface will not use this property and should return false.

member.summary: Queries whether the operation has completed.

member.summary: Gets the range index parameter for MappingService.DoAction or MappingService.BeginDoAction.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices
member.summary: This class contains constants describing the existing ELS services for Windows 7.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices.LanguageDetection
member.summary: The guid of the Microsoft Language Detection service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices.ScriptDetection
member.summary: The guid of the Microsoft Script Detection service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices.TransliterationHantToHans
member.summary: The guid of the Microsoft Traditional Chinese to Simplified Chinese Transliteration service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices.TransliterationHansToHant
member.summary: The guid of the Microsoft Simplified Chinese to Traditional Chinese Transliteration service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices.TransliterationMalayalamToLatin
member.summary: The guid of the Microsoft Malayalam to Latin Transliteration service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices.TransliterationDevanagariToLatin
member.summary: The guid of the Microsoft Devanagari to Latin Transliteration service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices.TransliterationCyrillicToLatin
member.summary: The guid of the Microsoft Cyrillic to Latin Transliteration service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingAvailableServices.TransliterationBengaliToLatin
member.summary: The guid of the Microsoft Bengali to Latin Transliteration service.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange
member.summary: Contains text recognition results for a recognized text subrange. An array of structures of this type is retrieved by an ELS service in a MappingPropertyBag structure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.GetData
member.summary: The data retrieved as service output associated with the subrange. This data must be of the format indicated by the content type supplied in the ContentType property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.FormatData``1(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter{``0})
member.summary: Formats the low-level data contained in this MappingDataRange using an implementation of the IMappingFormatter interface.
member.typeparam: The type with which IMappingFormatter is parameterized.
member.param: The formatter to be used in the formatting.
member.returns: A formatted version of this MappingDataRange.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.StartIndex
member.summary: Index of the beginning of the subrange in the text, where 0 indicates the first character of the string passed to MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText, instead of an offset to the index passed to the function in the index parameter. The value should be less than the entire length of the text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.EndIndex
member.summary: Index of the end of the subrange in the text, where 0 indicates the first character at of the string passed to MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText, instead of an offset to the index passed to the function in the index parameter. The value should be less than the entire length of the text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.ContentType
member.summary:
A string specifying the MIME content type of the data returned by GetData(). Examples of content types are "text/plain", "text/html", and "text/css".
In Windows 7, the ELS services support only the content type "text/plain". A content type specification can be found at the IANA website: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.ActionIds
member.summary:
Available action IDs for this data range. Usable for calling MappingService.DoAction or MappingService.BeginDoAction.
In Windows 7, the ELS services do not expose any actions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.ActionDisplayNames
member.summary:
Available action display names for this data range. These strings can be localized.
In Windows 7, the ELS services do not expose any actions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions
member.summary: Contains options used to enumerate ELS services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Public constructor. Initializes an empty instance of MappingEnumOptions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.Category
member.summary: Optional. A service category, for example, "Transliteration". The application must set this member to null if the service category is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.InputLanguage
member.summary: Optional. An input language string, following the IETF naming convention, that identifies the input language that services should accept. The application can set this member to null if the supported input language is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.OutputLanguage
member.summary: Optional. An output language string, following the IETF naming convention, that identifies the output language that services use to retrieve results. The application can set this member to null if the output language is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.InputScript
member.summary: Optional. A standard Unicode script name that can be accepted by services. The application set this member to null if the input script is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.OutputScript
member.summary: Optional. A standard Unicode script name used by services. The application can set this member to null if the output script is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.InputContentType
member.summary:
Optional. A string, following the format of the MIME content types, that identifies the format that the services should be able to interpret when the application passes data. Examples of content types are "text/plain", "text/html", and "text/css". The application can set this member to null if the input content type is not a search criterion.
In Windows 7, the ELS services support only the content type "text/plain". A content type specification can be found at the IANA website: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.OutputContentType
member.summary: Optional. A string, following the format of the MIME content types, that identifies the format in which the services retrieve data. The application can set this member to null if the output content type is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.Guid
member.summary: Optional. A globally unique identifier (guid) structure for a specific service. The application must avoid setting this member at all if the guid is not a search criterion.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions
member.summary: Contains options for text recognition. The values stored in this structure affect the behavior and results of MappingRecognizeText.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Public constructor. Initializes an empty instance of MappingOptions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.InputLanguage
member.summary: Optional. An input language string, following the IETF naming convention, that identifies the input language that the service should be able to accept. The application can set this member to null to indicate that the service is free to interpret the input as any input language it supports.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.OutputLanguage
member.summary: Optional. An output language string, following the IETF naming convention, that identifies the output language that the service should be able to use to produce results. The application can set this member to null if the service should decide the output language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.InputScript
member.summary: Optional. A standard Unicode script name that should be accepted by the service. The application can set this member to null to let the service decide how handle the input.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.OutputScript
member.summary: Optional. A standard Unicode script name that the service should use to retrieve results. The application can set this member to null to let the service decide the output script.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.InputContentType
member.summary:
Optional. A string, following the format of the MIME content types, that identifies the format that the service should be able to interpret when the application passes data. Examples of content types are "text/plain", "text/html", and "text/css". The application can set this member to null to indicate the "text/plain" content type.
In Windows 7, the ELS services support only the content type "text/plain". A content type specification can be found at the IANA website: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.OutputContentType
member.summary: Optional. A string, following the format of the MIME content types, that identifies the format in which the service should retrieve data. The application can set this member to NULL to let the service decide the output content type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.ServiceFlag
member.summary:
Optional. Private flag that a service provider defines to affect service behavior. Services can interpret this flag as they require.
For Windows 7, none of the available ELS services support flags.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag
member.summary: Contains the text recognition data properties retrieved by MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag.Finalize
member.summary: Frees all unmanaged resources allocated for the property bag, if needed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag.GetResultRanges
member.summary: An array of MappingDataRange objects containing all recognized text range results. This member is populated by MappingService.RecognizeText or asynchronously with MappingService.BeginRecognizeText.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag.FormatData``1(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter{``0})
member.summary: Formats the low-level data contained in this MappingPropertyBag using an implementation of the IMappingFormatter interface.
member.typeparam: The type with which IMappingFormatter is parameterized.
member.param: The formatter to be used in the formatting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag.Dispose
member.summary: Frees all unmanaged resources allocated for the property bag.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up both managed and native resources.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingRecognizeAsyncResult
member.summary: A MappingAsyncResult subclass to be used only for asynchronous calls to text recognition. MappingService.BeginDoAction

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingRecognizeAsyncResult.Text
member.summary: Gets the text parameter for MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingRecognizeAsyncResult.Length
member.summary: Gets the length parameter for MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingRecognizeAsyncResult.Index
member.summary: Gets the index parameter for MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingRecognizeAsyncResult.Options
member.summary: Gets the options parameter for MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState
member.summary: This class serves as the result status of asynchronous calls to ELS and as the result status of linguistic exceptions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState.GetHashCode
member.summary: Uses the HResult param as the object hashcode.
member.returns: An integer hashcode

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares an Object for value equality.
member.param: Object to compare.
member.returns: True if obj is equal to this instance, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState.Equals(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState)
member.summary: Compares a MappingResultState obj for value equality.
member.param: MappingResultState to compare.
member.returns: True if obj is equal to this instance, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState.op_Equality(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState)
member.summary: Compares two MappingResultState objs for value equality.
member.param: First MappingResultState to compare.
Second MappingResultState to compare.
member.returns: True if the two MappingResultStates are equal, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState.op_Inequality(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState)
member.summary: Compares two MappingResultState objs against value equality.
member.param: First MappingResultState to compare.
Second MappingResultState to compare.
member.returns: True if the two MappingResultStates are not equal, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets a human-readable description of the HResult error code, as constructed by Win32Exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingResultState.HResult
member.summary: Gets the HResult error code associated with this structure.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService
member.summary: Represents an ELS service. A detailed overview of the Extended Linguistic Services platform is available at: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd317839(VS.85).aspx

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary:
Constructs a new MappingService object by instanciating an ELS service by its guid. For Windows 7, the only supported GUIDs are provided as readonly members of the MappingAvailableServices class.
If the service with the specified guid doesn't exist, a LinguisticException is thrown.
member.param: The guid of the service to instantiate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.GetServices(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of available ELS platform-supported services, along with associated information, according to application-specified criteria.
member.param: Optional. A MappingEnumOptions object containing criteria to use during enumeration of services. The application specifies null for this parameter to retrieve all installed services.
member.returns: An array of MappingService objects matching the criteria supplied in the options parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.RecognizeText(System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions)
member.summary: Calls an ELS service to recognize text. For example, the Microsoft Language Detection service will attempt to recognize the language in which the input text is written.
member.param: The text to recognize. The text must be UTF-16, but some services have additional requirements for the input format. This parameter cannot be set to null.

Optional. A MappingOptions object containing options that affect the result and behavior of text recognition. The application does not have to specify values for all object members. This parameter can be set to null to use the default mapping options.
member.returns: A MappingPropertyBag object in which the service has stored its results. The structure is filled with information produced by the service during text recognition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.RecognizeText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions)
member.summary: Calls an ELS service to recognize text. For example, the Microsoft Language Detection service will attempt to recognize the language in which the input text is written.
member.param: The text to recognize. The text must be UTF-16, but some services have additional requirements for the input format. This parameter cannot be set to null.
Length, in characters, of the text specified in text.
Index inside the specified text to be used by the service. This value should be between 0 and length-1. If the application wants to process the entire text, it should set this parameter to 0.

Optional. A MappingOptions object containing options that affect the result and behavior of text recognition. The application does not have to specify values for all object members. This parameter can be set to null to use the default mapping options.
member.returns: A MappingPropertyBag object in which the service has stored its results. The structure is filled with information produced by the service during text recognition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.BeginRecognizeText(System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Calls an ELS service to recognize text. For example, the Microsoft Language Detection service will attempt to recognize the language in which the input text is written. The execution will be handled in a thread from the managed thread pool, and the asynchronous wait handle of the returned MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object will be notified when the operation completes. The results of the call will be stored inside the MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object.
member.param: The text to recognize. The text must be UTF-16, but some services have additional requirements for the input format. This parameter cannot be set to null.

Optional. A MappingOptions object containing options that affect the result and behavior of text recognition. The application does not have to specify values for all object members. This parameter can be set to null to use the default mapping options.
An application callback delegate to receive callbacks with the results from the recognize operation. Cannot be set to null.

Optional. Private application object passed to the callback function by a service after text recognition is complete. The application must set this parameter to null to indicate no private application data.
member.returns: A MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object describing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.BeginRecognizeText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Calls an ELS service to recognize text. For example, the Microsoft Language Detection service will attempt to recognize the language in which the input text is written. The execution will be handled in a thread from the managed thread pool, and the asynchronous wait handle of the returned MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object will be notified when the operation completes. The results of the call will be stored inside the MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object.
member.param: The text to recognize. The text must be UTF-16, but some services have additional requirements for the input format. This parameter cannot be set to null.
Length, in characters, of the text specified in text.
Index inside the specified text to be used by the service. This value should be between 0 and length-1. If the application wants to process the entire text, it should set this parameter to 0.

Optional. A MappingOptions object containing options that affect the result and behavior of text recognition. The application does not have to specify values for all object members. This parameter can be set to null to use the default mapping options.
An application callback delegate to receive callbacks with the results from the recognize operation. Cannot be set to null.

Optional. Private application object passed to the callback function by a service after text recognition is complete. The application must set this parameter to null to indicate no private application data.
member.returns: A MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object describing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.EndRecognizeText(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingRecognizeAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits for the asynchronous operation to complete.
member.param: The MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object associated with the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.DoAction(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Causes an ELS service to perform an action after text recognition has occurred. For example, a phone dialer service first must recognize phone numbers and then can perform the "action" of dialing a number.
member.param: A MappingPropertyBag object containing the results of a previous call to MappingService.MappingRecognizeText. This parameter cannot be set to null.
A starting index inside the text recognition results for a recognized text range. This value should be between 0 and the range count.
The identifier of the action to perform. This parameter cannot be set to null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.BeginDoAction(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag,System.Int32,System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Causes an ELS service to perform an action after text recognition has occurred. For example, a phone dialer service first must recognize phone numbers and then can perform the "action" of dialing a number.
member.param: A MappingPropertyBag object containing the results of a previous call to MappingService.MappingRecognizeText. This parameter cannot be set to null.
A starting index inside the text recognition results for a recognized text range. This value should be between 0 and the range count.
The identifier of the action to perform. This parameter cannot be set to null.
An application callback delegate to receive callbacks with the results from the action operation. Cannot be set to null.

Optional. Private application object passed to the callback function by a service after the action operation is complete. The application must set this parameter to null to indicate no private application data.
member.returns: A MappingActionAsyncResult object describing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.EndDoAction(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingActionAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits for the asynchronous operation to complete.
member.param: The MappingActionAsyncResult object associated with the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.ThrowIfNotWin7
member.summary: Throws PlatformNotSupportedException if the application is not running on Windows 7

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.Copyright
member.summary: Copyright information about the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.MajorVersion
member.summary: Major version number that is used to track changes to the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.MinorVersion
member.summary: Minor version number that is used to track changes to the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.BuildVersion
member.summary: Build version that is used to track changes to the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.StepVersion
member.summary: Step version that is used to track changes to the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.InputContentTypes
member.summary: Optional. A collection of input content types, following the format of the MIME content types, that identify the format that the service interprets when the application passes data. Examples of content types are "text/plain", "text/html" and "text/css".

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.OutputContentTypes
member.summary: Optional. A collection of output content types, following the format of the MIME content types, that identify the format in which the service retrieves data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.InputLanguages
member.summary: A collection of the input languages, following the IETF naming convention, that the service accepts. This member is set to null if the service can work with any input language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.OutputLanguages
member.summary: A collection of output languages, following the IETF naming convention, in which the service can retrieve results. This member is set to null if the service can retrieve results in any language, or if the service ignores the output language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.InputScripts
member.summary: A collection of input scripts, with Unicode standard script names, that are supported by the service. This member is set to null if the service can work with any scripts, or if the service ignores the input scripts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.OutputScripts
member.summary: A collection of output scripts supported by the service. This member is set to null if the service can work with any scripts, or the service ignores the output scripts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.Guid
member.summary: Globally unique identifier (guid) for the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.Category
member.summary: The service category for the service, for example, "Transliteration".

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.Description
member.summary: The service description. This text can be localized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.IsOneToOneLanguageMapping
member.summary: Flag indicating the language mapping between input language and output language that is supported by the service. Possible values are shown in the following table. 0 - The input and output languages are not paired and the service can receive data in any of the input languages and render data in any of the output languages. 1 - The arrays of the input and output languages for the service are paired. In other words, given a particular input language, the service retrieves results in the paired language defined in the output language array. Use of the language pairing can be useful, for example, in bilingual dictionary scenarios.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.IsPlatformSupported
member.summary: Indicates whether this feature is supported on the current platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.RunningOnWin7
member.summary: Determines if the application is running on Windows 7

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.NullTerminatedStringFormatter
member.summary: Converts byte arrays containing Unicode null-terminated strings into .NET string objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.NullTerminatedStringFormatter.Format(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange)
member.summary: Converts a single MappingDataRange into a string, stripping the trailing null character. If the string doesn't contain null characters, the empty string is returned.
member.param: The MappingDataRange to convert
member.returns: The resulting string

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.NullTerminatedStringFormatter.FormatAll(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag)
member.summary: Uses Format to format all the ranges of the supplied MappingPropertyBag.
member.param: The property bag to convert.
member.returns: An array of strings, one per MappingDataRange.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.Resources.LocalizedMessages
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.Resources.LocalizedMessages.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.Resources.LocalizedMessages.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.Resources.LocalizedMessages.SupportedWindows7
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Only supported on Windows 7 or newer..

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.StringArrayFormatter
member.summary: Converts registry-formatted data into string arrays.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.StringArrayFormatter.Format(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange)
member.summary: Converts a single MappingDataRange into a string array by splitting on each null character and removing the empty entries.
member.param: The MappingDataRange to convert
member.returns: The resulting string array

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.StringArrayFormatter.FormatAll(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag)
member.summary: Uses Format to format all the ranges of the supplied MappingPropertyBag.
member.param: The property bag to convert.
member.returns: An array of string arrays, one per MappingDataRange.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.ExtendedLinguisticServices.StringFormatter
member.summary: Converts byte arrays into Unicode (UTF-16) strings.

member.summary: Converts a single MappingDataRange into a string.
member.param: The MappingDataRange to convert
member.returns: The resulting string
